snippet: Investors were concerned that subscribers would flee British Sky Broadcasting, which has built its subscriber base with soccer programming.
abstract: Shares in British Sky Broadcasting drop after its rival, BT, snatches British television rights to Champions League soccer, Europe's top club competition; investors are concerned that subscribers will flee BSkyB, which has built its subscriber base with soccer programming.
lead_paragraph: Investors were concerned that subscribers would flee British Sky Broadcasting, which has built its subscriber base with soccer programming.

headline.main: BSkyB’s Shares Fall After BT Takes Over Champions League
headline.print_headline: Loss of Soccer Rights Is Costly for BSkyB
